questions.question_text: Software-defined networking architecture is used for cost-effective, adaptable and easily manageable applications. In which two software-defined networks is SDN commonly used? (Choose two.)
Sometimes SDN leverages various overlay networking technologies to create layer(s) of network abstraction. What describes an overlay network?

choices.B: It encapsulates packets at source and destination, which incurs additional overhead
choices.C: Packet delivery and reliability occurs at Layer 3 and Layer 4
choices.D: It is responsible for the delivery of packets; NAT- or VRF-based segregation is required
choices.A: It transmits packets that traverse over network devices like switches and routers

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
I think correct answer is B.

Overlay networks create a layer of network abstraction by encapsulating packets at source and destination. This encapsulation allows virtual networks to be built on top of physical networks, creating new network segments without modifying the existing network infrastructure.

Selected Answer: B
An overlay network is a virtual network that is built on top of an existing physical network infrastructure. It creates a layer of network abstraction by encapsulating packets at the source and destination endpoints. This encapsulation adds an additional overhead to the packets as they traverse the underlying physical network. The overlay network allows for logical isolation and segmentation of network traffic, enabling the implementation of virtual networks with specific characteristics and policies.

Selected Answer: B
B is correct
I go with 'B' however, encapsulation occurs only at source - de-encapsulation occurs at destination

Selected Answer: B
B to me. O 
Devices on overlay networks are interconnected through logical links, constituting overlay topologies.
Tunnels are established between interconnected overlay devices. When sending a data packet, a device adds a new IP header and a tunnel header to the data packet and shields the inner IP header. The data packet is then forwarded based on the new IP header. When the data packet is received by another device, the device removes the outer IP header and tunnel header to obtain the original data packet. In this process, overlay network devices are unaware of the underlay network.

Refer to the exhibit. This network is running OSPF as the routing protocol. The internal networks are being advertised in OSPF London and Rome are using the direct link to reach each other although the transfer rates are better via Barcelona. Which OSPF design change allows OSPF to calculate the proper costs?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B fore sure.

Selected Answer: B
I think correct answer is B.

OSPF uses a default reference bandwidth when calculating link costs. If the link is very fast, the default reference bandwidth may not be used to accurately calculate the cost. By changing the reference bandwidth, OSPF can calculate accurate costs that reflect the actual speed of the link. As a result, faster routes will be selected.

Selected Answer: B
The reference bandwidth is a value in Mbps that we can set ourselves. By default, this is 100Mbps on Cisco IOS routers.
